intro: Drimyspermum, commonly known as the broadleaf drimys, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South America, particularly in regions of Chile and Argentina. The plants typically have woody stems and are characterized by their broad, leathery leaves. Drimyspermum species produce small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. These plants are generally found in moist, temperate climates and are valued for their ornamental appeal.
